beer.beer_description: Meanwhile, everything is not always what it seems. Set aside your everyday logic, and on this golden afternoon, let this beer transport you to a far-off land of possibilities. This is what dreams are made of.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 340 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 69!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 235 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 48!

You’ve pledged allegiance, and now it’s time to enjoy some beer! Now remember, not all American beer is fizzy and yellow. That’s 400 different beers from a brewery in the United States. Try 5 more for Level 81!

beer.beer_description:
It doesn't get much fresher than this folks. We took 350 pounds of Colorado grown Chinook fresh off the farm and jammed it all into this tasty expression of fresh hop goodness. A chinook heavy IPA is supported by Simcoe and Idaho 7, two of our other favorite hops. Expect a floral bouquet bursting with fresh green hop flavor.

Tastin note: Stonefruit. Citrus. Zesty.
Coffee Cream Ale using Super Thing coffee in collaboration with the Austin Public Library

items.badge_description: One cannot live on dank hops alone. Tone down the bitterness and enjoy some smooth flavor. That's 285 different beers with an IBU of 20 or below.  Try 5 more for Level 58!

beer.beer_description: Golden IPA with clean, light, biscuit malt character that allows the hop flavors to shine through. We taste and smell marmalade, blueberries, and the devil's lettuce.
Texas Lager. At Meanwhile, we value the tiny things and the precious moments—so we brewed this beer to be shared. Here’s to light hearts, full beers, and porch sittin’ with your Darlin’.
Formerly known as Teddy Ballgame. Pillsner malt. Tettnanger, Hallertau Mittelfruh, and Saphir hops. Augustiner yeast.

items.badge_description: It's New Brew Thursday! Drink any beer you have never had before on three different Thursdays in a 20 day period.

beer.beer_description: Golden IPA with clean, light, biscuit malt character that allows the hop flavors to shine through. We taste and smell marmalade, blueberries, and the devil's lettuce.

items.checkin_comment: Finally found a fresh hop. Delicious

items.badge_description: Light and crisp, a Pilsner is all you need to make your day great. Though, perhaps another one would make it even better. That’s 145 different Pilsners. Try 5 more for Level 30!

items.badge_description:
Everyone loves fresh beer, but obviously not as much as you do. You went straight to the source. 

That's a beer at 85 different venues categorized as a Brewery, Cidery or Meadery. Visit 5 more for Level 18!

beer.beer_description: Meanwhile, everything is not always what it seems. Set aside your everyday logic, and on this golden afternoon, let this beer transport you to a far-off land of possibilities. This is what dreams are made of.

Munich’s Oktoberfest is the largest Volksfest in the world, but you don’t have to go to all the way to Bavaria to celebrate. Our Oktoberfest is a malty, easy-drinking tribute to the only beer poured at the fest. 

Tasting notes: Breadcrumb. Floral. Citrus

Legends aren't born. They're made from scratch. Still family-owned and operated, our favorite institution has been serving legendary Tex-Mex to Austin since 1952. We brewed this Tex-Mex lager in their honor- crisp, classic, and made to pair with tradition.

items.checkin_comment: Tastes like a cream ale poured through a used coffee filter. Gets worse the more you drink it. Can’t all be winners 💀

beer.beer_description: Coffee Cream Ale using Super Thing coffee in collaboration with the Austin Public Library

items.checkin_comment: Like having your dessert coffee… but it’s beer

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 100 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 21!

A relative of the American light lager style, cream ales are crisp, golden brews, often finished with the addition of lager yeast for a lighter body. That's 5 different beers with the style of Cream Ale. Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description: Golden IPA with clean, light, biscuit malt character that allows the hop flavors to shine through. We taste and smell marmalade, blueberries, and the devil's lettuce.
Hazy IPA. This is your island beer. Tropical fruit flavors bursting out of the glass. Take your time to pick out each of the fruit flavors in there.
Formerly known as Teddy Ballgame. Pillsner malt. Tettnanger, Hallertau Mittelfruh, and Saphir hops. Augustiner yeast.

LONG STORY SHORT

This dreamy IPA wraps your senses in a soft, tropical haze of juicy flavors. Each sip is a journey of cosmic proportions.

Tasting Notes:

Strawberry. Orange Creamsicle. Melon.

Nobody panic! This Northwest IPA is layered with Mosaic, Comet, El Dorado and Simcoe hops to bring you all of the classic pine and citrus flavors we love, with a new school touch of pineapple and berries.
Hazy India Pale Ale - All the haze, all the "juice" and, of course, all them hops. Rakau and Citra are the super stars in this delicious concoction.
Loaded with Nelson Sauvin hops that bring out flavors of gooseberry, blueberry, and white grapes.
German style Helles lager

West Coast IPA - Embrace the journey and feast your eyes on the edible colors in your hand. Let the flavors dance across your pallet and awake your senses. It should be a fun trip.

Malt: Pilsner, Vienna, White Wheat
Hops: Cascade, Simcoe, Simcoe Extract, Mosaic, Nectaron, Idaho 7 Cryo
Yeast: Chico

An Arnold Palmer-inspired Kölsch.
A nice cold Arnold Palmer on a hot day or after a round of golf can't be beat, except maybe by an ice cold beer. So we decided to put them together. 
This is the first in a series of tea (or should we say tee?) beers you'll see from Meanwhile. For this round, we used Exceptional Iced tea from @smithteamaker and lemon zest to bring you

Munich’s Oktoberfest is the largest Volksfest in the world, but you don’t have to go to all the way to Bavaria to celebrate. Our Oktoberfest is a malty, easy-drinking tribute to the only beer poured at the fest. 

Tasting notes: Breadcrumb. Floral. Citrus
Hazy IPA. A tap on the shoulder, a ding-dong ditch, a sleight of hand, a playful trick. Don't be afraid of a little mischief.
West Coast IPA. We raise a glass to those whose glass is always half full. May we always celebrate the extraordinary in life's most ordinary moments.
This pillowy soft and ethereal IPA will stretch your consciousness to the outer bounds of reality. Travelers, no need to beware. Sit back and expand your mind with a pint of this hazy IPA.

Many brewers judge other breweries on their lagers, because it shows the craftsmanship. Unlike some other styles, most lager styles don't have much to hide behind, so the ingredients and technique really show. This is another classic German-Lager for our list. Go ahead, judge away, but don't be too harsh.
WE TASTE: Tangerine, Watermelon, Pineapple

Meanwhile, everything is not always what it seems. Set aside your everyday logic, and on this golden afternoon, let this beer transport you to a far-off land of possibilities. This is what dreams are made of.

The coup de grâce of our 8 part artist series showcasing Timo Kuilder and his explorative display of balance and contrast. This Final Hazy IPA in the series is a brilliant display of restraint, texture and aroma. A final statement piece is among us for your enjoyment and elicitation.

Made for moments just like these. ⁠
This highly approachable Pale Ale is packed full of fruit flavor with just a touch of bitterness to balance it all out. Pack it with you for your next Summer adventure and keep on the sunny side of life.⁠
We taste: Peach • Passion Fruit • Tangerine⁠

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description:
Long Story Short

The embers glow through the fire is fading.  Gold in the wreckage, the last light parading.

Shattered glass still cathes the sun.  A glimmer of beauty in what's come undone.

So lift your gaze as the dark draws in.  Breathe deep the glow, drink it in.

We Taste

Passion Fruit * Orange Strawberry

Japanese-Style Lager. In Japan, Rice accompanies almost every meal. And beer accompanies most meals. We've just put them together. Enjoy this crushable, delicious lager any time, with anything. Have it with a side of rice and another beer too.

Czech-Style Dark Lager. Czech lagers as a whole are characterized by full body and high drinkability and that's something we can get behind. This versatile libation brings the full richness and complexity of a Dunkel lager combined with the smooth roast of a Schwarzbier. Who says you can't have the best of both worlds?
Dark lagers with notes of toast and choclate. Munich I and II, pilsner, Caramunich, and Carafa III specials malts. Hersbrucker and Halkatau Mittlefrih hops and Augustine yeast.

Winter Lager with Spruce Tips. This festive lager is a collaboration beer with our friends from Cruz Blanca, a brewpub & taquería out of Chicago. In addition to classic styles, Cruz Blanca typically brews beers with various adjuncts that are often inspired by the culinary world. This specific beer utilizes spruce tips which delivers a berry and citrus flavor. It's a perfect beer to bring some brightness and warmth during the cold winter months here in Austin.

Consider this beer a love letter to one of our favorite hops- Saphir. While Saphir is prominently featured in our year-round Meanwhile Pilsner, this Italian-style pilsner really puts it center stage. While "noble" hops like Saphir are not what you would typically find in an IPA, using them in a restrained dry hop imparts a complex aromatic bouquet to this humble pilsner. For folks who love helles and pilsner look no further for your next favorite brew. Alla tua salute!
